node.display_long_description:
WARNING: This is a highly addictive VR game and must be played with at least one other person who joins the game on a mobile device.

The golden acorns are under attack! It’s up to you and your friends to protect them or steal them in this cross-platform party game, Acron: Attack of the Squirrels!, from Resolution Games.

A game that’s at its best when played as a couch party game together with a group of friends, Acron: Attack of the Squirrels! is both competitive and cooperative in nature for players across VR and mobile devices.

In this hilariously fun experience, one player in VR takes on the role of a large, ancient tree that is the sole protector of the golden acorns. Meanwhile, one to eight frenemies can then grab their iOS and Android devices to become rebel squirrels - who can be customized with 12 unique skins! -  that'll do anything to steal the golden acorns using an arsenal of unique abilities across seven different maps.

latest_supported_binary.change_log: Just in time for Halloween, the squirrels have discovered a creepy new level, and it’s nuttin’ but spooky fun! Join the gang as they take on the tree in the “Sulky Swamp,” check out the new 1 vs. 1 gameplay allowing just one player on mobile to take on the tree in VR, and download the Haunted Horrors skins for free!

nodes.title: Acron: Attack of the Squirrels! Game Update: Sulky Swamp Halloween Update
nodes.body_text:
Your favorite squirrels are back with a terrifying update including the brand new Halloween themed map Sulky Swamp,  level selection and more!

Game Updates:
- New level: Sulky Swamp
- One mobile player required to start game instead of two
- Removed region visuals/simplified room code
- Support emails include extra information
- Notch on some phones is no longer obstructing the view of the game
- Added official iPad support
- A lot of networking fixes
- Made it possible for AIs to have overlaying level structures (like bridges)
- Added new UI for selecting maps and change number of bots
- Added network message for when the tree leaves the match using the exit button which shows a message on the phones that the tree quit the match instead of disconnected
- Made one skin set free (Haunting Horrors skins)
- Gave name to all levels
- Added possibility to adjust number of bots in-between levels
- Changed how nametags look and behave, below squirrels and are hidden if you can't see the squirrel
- Moved win screen UI on phones
- AI can now throw acorn towards players
- Changed wording on some places
- Made the lobby include less info to make it feel lighter
- Chunk can no longer carry the shield inside a tunnel

Bug Fixes:
- Fixed Android crash (OBB)
- Fixed iPhone 6 crash (RAM)
- Fixed issue with Steam not being able to start match
- Fixed bug with player names in the lobby
- Players can no longer join a game without a name
- Fixed bug with tunnels looping animation when hotjoining
- Fixed bug where the acorn’s location switches between players
- Fixed bug where squirrel name tags become visible when picked up by the tree
- Fixed bug causing delay on continue button when switching between settings and match stats.
- Fixed bug with Chunk animations when not carrying shield
- Bots got stuck in a flickering movement if they were close to the acorn but on the wrong height - Fixed issue with bots getting stuck when close to an acorn
- Fixed bug where knocked out squirrels could go through tunnels
- Fixed bug where music starts over when exiting skin view on mobile
- Fixed bug with adjust bots button being clickable when it wasn’t supposed to be

node.reviewDescription: We a family of 6 (living in the home, 10 with everyone) find it hard to play any game that isn’t cards or board games, which we love. But when we found this game it was and is incredible. Our son who has adhd (bad) loves to be the tree and defend his acorns. Tires him out. Our daughter who has a couple different abilities loves to play and not feel like she’s less of a person cause she’s not at the bigger kids level. Last night our grandson tried (4yo) and picked up both sides of the game fast. He loved being the tree the most. But the most amazing thing is our daughter and her family can be the squirrels at their home and we just be on speakers. So in this pandemic we’re all in and having different shut downs across the planet we can still connect and have a blast. HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS. Even our teenagers play with their younger siblings and my husband, who would rather be in the garage will stop and come play.

website_page_meta.description:
WARNING: This is a highly addictive VR game and must be played with at least one other person who joins the game on a mobile device. The mobile game for iOS and Android is free.

Do you have what it takes to protect the golden acorns in this new multiplayer party game from Resolution Games, or are you feeling a little squirrely?
website_page_meta.title: Acron: Attack of the Squirrels! · Oculus Quest
